p.Open to business and non-business studen: Open to business and non-business students.

courseSection0.text:
Open to business and non-business students.
Admission Requirements
None
Certificate Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
GEB3375 - Introduction to International Business (3)
courseSection0.text1: Select 6 to 9 hours of Study Abroad:
courseSection0.text2:
Earn at least 3 credits from the following types of courses: 
GEB 3955 - Study Abroad
courseSection0.text3:
Earn at least 3 credits from the following types of courses: 
GEB 4955 - Study Abroad

courseSection1.text0: Select one of the courses below only if less than 9 hours of Study Abroad completed
courseSection1.text1: Another restricted elective may be approved at the discretion of the Associate Director of Study Abroad in the College of Business Administration
courseSection1.text2:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
GEB4374 - International Negotiations and Transactions (3)
MAN4600 - International Management (3)
MAN4441 - Conflict Resolution and Negotiation (3)
MAR4156 - International Marketing (3)
GEO3471 - World Political Geography (3)
LAS3002 - Topics in Latin American Studies (3)
JST3821 - Israel: Start-Up Nation (3)
GEA4405 - Geography of Latin America (3)

li.A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all: A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
li.Lower division courses taken at Florida: Lower division courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
li.Courses taken as part of a UCF College o: Courses taken as part of a UCF College of Business exchange program, will be reviewed for appropriateness by the College of Business Study Abroad Director. Additional information may be required by the Study Abroad Director to determine the appropriateness of the course taken.
li.Courses transferred into the College of: Courses transferred into the College of Business from a foreign institution, that are not part of a College of Business exchange program, must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
li.At least nine hours used in the minor mu: At least nine hours used in the minor must be coursework registered through UCF College of Business Study Abroad.
li.No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit): No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
li.Internship, Independent Study, or Direct: Internship, Independent Study, or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements
A minimum GPA of 2.0 is required in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
Lower division courses taken at Florida College System institutions do not substitute for upper division courses.
Courses taken as part of a UCF College of Business exchange program, will be reviewed for appropriateness by the College of Business Study Abroad Director. Additional information may be required by the Study Abroad Director to determine the appropriateness of the course taken.
Courses transferred into the College of Business from a foreign institution, that are not part of a College of Business exchange program, must be formally evaluated for equivalency credit. The student must provide a course syllabus and any other supporting information with his/her petition for this evaluation.
At least nine hours used in the minor must be coursework registered through UCF College of Business Study Abroad.
No credit by exam (TSD, Military credit) may be used.
Internship, Independent Study, or Directed Research credit cannot be used toward the minor.
